zone.line: as has been said
Poetry in this respects differs from logic
that it is not subject to the controul
of the active powers of the mind, &
that its birth & recurrence has no
necessary connexion with consciousness
or will.— It is presumptuous to
determine that these are the necessary
causation
conditions of all mental action when
mental
effects are experienced insusceptible
of being referred to them. The
frequent recurrence of the poetical
power, it is obvious to suppose
may produce in the mind of the
poet an habit of order & harmony
correlative with it's own nature &
with its effects upon other minds.
But in the intervals of inspiration
-ation, & they may be frequent
without being durable, a Poet
becomes a man and is abandoned
sudden refluen reflux of the
to the influences of under which
